revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Greg London | image = GregLondonSm.jpg | caption = Greg London of ''The ICONS in London'' | birth_name = | birth_date = December 26, 1966 | birth_place = Northern California, USA | death_date = | death_place = | other_names = | occupation = | known_for = [[Impressionist (entertainment)|impressions]] | years_active= 1962 to Present | instrument = Vocals, trumpet, piano, guitar, harmonica, percussion instruments | agent = | spouse = | website = [http://www.gregorylondon.com gregorylondon.com] }} '''Greg London''' is an American [[singing|singer]], [[entertainer]] and [[Impressionist (entertainment)|impressionist]]. After a solo hit show in [[West End theatre|London's West End]], he enjoyed a lengthy residency in [[Reno, Nevada]] before announcing his move to the [[Las Vegas Strip]] in mid-2010. ==Biography== ===Early life=== London was born in [[Northern California]] to an English mother and an American father. When he was a young boy he moved with his mother to [[England]] where he went to school, but they continued to travel back and forth between England and [[California]]. As a child he played the [[trumpet]] with his grandfather in the Salvation Army’s local brass band, and later played first chair trumpet in the [[California Youth Symphony]]. Greg is the godson of English trumpeter Ronnie Hunt, whose claims to fame include the ''[[Coronation Street]]'' signature tune,[http://www.jazzprofessional.com/interviews/Stan%20Roderick_3.htm Stan Roderick, A tribute by Ron Simmonds] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081205194520/http://www.jazzprofessional.com/interviews/Stan%20Roderick_3.htm |date=2008-12-05 }}, ''Jazz Professional'', 1994[http://findarticles.com/p/news-articles/mail-on-sunday-london-england-the/mi_8003/is_2009_June_21/brass-warfare-coronation-street-rival/ai_n38243210/],"Mail On Sunday", London taught himself to play several musical instruments, and regularly performs the trumpet, guitar, piano, harmonica and percussion instruments in his shows. A student of Dramatic Arts from 1976 to 1979 at Cabrillo College, College of Marin, Deanza College and workshops at UCSC, he trained in acting at San Francisco Dramatic Arts under James Dunn and Harvey Susser.[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2091696/resume Greg London on IMDB], IMDB ===Life in Performance=== He performed in theatre and musical comedy in England and America, beginning as a child in [[Windsor, Berkshire|Windsor]] near [[London]], UK,http://www.sacbee.com/travel/story/1676548.html and in his early twenties south of [[San Francisco]] he starred as Billy Crocker in ''[[Anything Goes]]'' with the Civic Light Opera, opposite stage legend [[Chita Rivera]] as Reno Sweeney. He auditioned for film and television, gaining several small roles during this same time. His first recording release, ''Alive Again in Santa Cruz'' (1979), sold a few thousand copies through East Records, [[Tokyo]], Japan. London formed a band in 1984, playing many hundreds of dates in clubs all over California, [[Nevada]], [[Arizona]] and [[Colorado]]. He began developing his singing voice, and was discovered in [[Pebble Beach]], California by [[Jack Welch]] of [[General Electric]],[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-53141468.html Pebble Beach, Calif., Singer a Hit on the Corporate Circuit], [[Knight Ridder]]/Tribune Business News, October 27, 1998 which led to many opportunities to play at varied events in the corporate world. By the early 1990s he had become known on America’s corporate entertainment circuit with his musical impressions-based comedic performance to showcase his talents. London then recorded ''Song of America'' at [[A&M Studios]]. This was a CD of old and new American patriotic music, arranged by [[Grammy Award]]-winning pianist and arranger Randy Waldman and mixed by another Grammy Award winner, engineer Jeffrey (Woody) Woodruff.http://www.songofamerica.tv/music.html[http://www.songofamerica.tv Song of America] After this he went on a two-year tour singing for the American troops; his performances received positive reviews,[http://www.gregorylondon.com/greg/articles-reviews/song-of-america/111-song-of-america-review-sauk-valley-newspapers.html Cohesive compilation creates inspiring album], Sauk Valley, Tim O’Brien (Entertainment Editor) 21 June 2007. Cited at gregorylondon.com including
"Inspirational, truly great, emotionally charged performance." - [[Clint Eastwood]]
In winter 2007 he returned to England with his own show at [[The Venue Leicester Square|The Venue]] in London's [[West End theatre|West End]].https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jdDWLCGIZq8 ''The ICONS in London'' opened to rave reviews by both media[http://www.britishtheatreguide.info/reviews/icons-rev.htm Review of ''The Icons in London''] at ''The British Theatre Guide''[http://www.thegregshow.tv/mediareviews.html More media reviews in London] and audiences[http://www.thegregshow.tv/audiencereviews.html Audience reviews in London] alike.
"Greg London has a rare gift for impersonating the pop world's biggest artists. ''The Icons in London'' showcases his uncanny vocal talent... This human jukebox could perform an entire gig in any pop persona of his choosing... It's the music that moves and uplifts. London is the polished conduit for it, and the evening is best appreciated for a winter warm up, thank you to America for giving us the soundtracks to our lives." - [[The Daily Telegraph|Daily Telegraph]][https://www.telegraph.co.uk/arts/main.jhtml?xml=/arts/2007/01/17/bticon117.xml "This human jukebox is on the button."] Daily Telegraph, January 17, 2007.
He appeared and sang in the 2008 movie ''The Dukes'', directed by [[Robert Davi]].{{IMDb title|id=470737|title=The Dukes}}. See also [http://www.thedukes-movie.com/ Official movie website][http://www.life.com/image/83671067 LIFE magazine] From July 2007 to the end of 2009 he performed at the Sammy Davis Jr Showroom at [[Harrah's Entertainment]] in [[Reno, Nevada]].[http://www.thegregshow.tv/harrahsreviews.html Media reviews in Reno] In January 2008 he was named the "Show of the Year" by the entertainment editor of the ''[[Sacramento Bee]]''.[http://www.casinotravelnews.com/Reno_Lake_Tahoe/Reno_LakeTahoe_Entertainment/reno_laketahoe_entertainment.html Hottest must see show in Reno], Show of The Year 2008, ''Casino Travel News'' By the end of 2008 he had become one of Reno's longest-running solo entertainers ever.Jack Neal, [http://www.nevada-events.net/cgi-bin/cal_manager2/review626.shtml Greg London, Reno's new Mr. Entertainment, is back in town and he's better than ever], ''Nevada Events'', April 3, 2009 In July 2009 he won Best Entertainer of Nevada in the ''Nevada Magazine'' readers poll, and Best Show of Northern Nevada for his [[comedy rock]] stylized ICONS an episodic satire musical that utilizes mixing genres, both lampooning and parodies of iconic artists and original satire; created by London and written in the classic literary format, The Hero's Journey, with theater director David Taylor and London playwright Paul Miller.[http://www.nevadamagazine.com/index.php/events-and-shows/details/greg_londons_iconman/ Greg London "ICONMAN" ], ''Nevada Magazine''. Retrieved 2009-07-22[http://www.nevadamagazine.com/index.php/issues/read/greg_london/ Events & Shows Cover Sept/Oct Greg London], ''Nevada Magazine''. Retrieved 2009-08-22 At the end of 2009 London garnered a "best impersonation" credit in ''[[The Huffington Post]]''.David Wild (''[[Rolling Stone]]'' contributing editor), [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/david-wild/the-only-best-albums-of-t_b_398829.html The Only Best Albums of the Year List That Really Matters], Huffington Post, December 20, 2009 In July 2011 he won Best Show of Nevada in the ''Nevada Magazine'' readers poll. On May 27, 2010 the Las Vegas Review Journal announced a move to the [[Riviera (hotel and casino)|Riviera]].Mike Weatherford, LVRJ [http://www.lvrj.com/neon/risk-pays-off-for--jersey-boys--star-faugno-95000749.html], Las Vegas Review Journal May. 27, 2010 At the Red Carpet Media event September 2, 2010 Riviera President, Bob Vanucci, told the media the resort secured Greg London after searching for a performer who could fill the void left in the Las Vegas Strip entertainment landscape by the death of long time Strip performer, [[Danny Gans]]. Greg London was presented with three congratulatory letters from Nevada Governor Gibbons, Congresswoman Dina Titus and Senator Ensign, September 2, 2010 was declared by proclamation Greg London's ICONS Day by Las Vegas Mayor Oscar Goodman.[http://wn.com/Greg_London_ICONS_Show_Riviera_Hotel_After_Party_Speech_9-2-10], World News, September 2, 2010[http://www1.wireimage.com/GalleryListing.asp?navtyp=CAL====450250&qckv=y&nbc1=1], Wire Image, September 2, 2010 He was then moved to the [[Las Vegas Hilton]] in early 2011.[http://lasvegas.broadwayworld.com/article/BWW_Reviews_Greg_London_at_the_Hilton_Impressions_That_Do_Indeed_Rock_20110303], BWW Reviews: Greg London at The Hilton, March 3, 2011[http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2011/mar/02/photos-greg-londons-new-home-las-vegas-hilton/], Las Vegas Sun ===Hit singles=== Greg London's success as a [[pop music]] artist began during the 2008 [[Christmas and holiday season|holiday season]], when his rendition of “[[Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas]]” debuted as the #2 most added track on [[FMQB]]’s AC40 Chart and [[Radio & Records]] (Billboard) [[Adult Contemporary (chart)|Adult Contemporary]] chart during the same week.[https://www.reuters.com/article/pressRelease/idUS209497+05-Dec-2008+BW20081205 Press release], Reuters, December 5, 2008 It peaked at #40 on FMQB. London followed up with a cover of the [[David Gates]] song “[[Everything I Own]]” (originally a hit for the soft rock group [[Bread (band)|Bread]] in [[1972 in music|1972]]). It stayed in the Top 30 on the [[Mediabase]] and R&R airplay charts for eleven weeks, reaching #25 and #26 respectively;Position 25 on [https://www.usatoday.com/life/music/airplay-charts.htm USA TODAY airplay charts as compiled by Mediabase], retrieved April 14, 2009 it hit number 5 on the FMQB AC40 Chart.Position 5 on [http://www.fmqb.com/Article.asp?id=16693 FMQB AC40], updated April 29, 2009, retrieved May 5, 2009 London's next single released to radio, a cover of the [[Glenn Shorrock]] song “[[Cool Change (song)|Cool Change]]” (originally a hit for the soft rock group [[Little River Band]] in [[1979 in music|1979]]), hit the Top 30 on the Media Base and R&R airplay charts on August 18, 2009 and went to #5 on FMQB AC40.Position 25 on [https://www.usatoday.com/life/music/airplay-charts.htm USA TODAY airplay charts as compiled by Mediabase], retrieved August 20, 2009 ===Awards=== In 2001 London was presented with the Spotlight Award for “Entertainer of the Year” for his dynamic performances in the corporate world.[http://www.event-solutions.com/spotlight_awards/spotlight_award_recipients/2001_st_louis Spotlight Award 2001] Hollywood Music in Media Awards HMMA - On November 19, 2009 Greg London and "Everything I Own" won the award for Best Adult Contemporary Song for the highest charting new artist release and release on an independent label on all three AC Radio airplay charts.[http://www.hmmawards.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=category&layout=blog&id=36&Itemid=88 HMMA] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090926030445/http://www.hmmawards.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=category&layout=blog&id=36&Itemid=88 |date=2009-09-26 }}, Hollywood Music in Media Awards nominees retrieved, August 29, 2009[http://www.marketwatch.com/story/greg-londons-debut-hit-single-everything-i-own-receives-a-hollywood-music-in-media-awards-hmma-nomination-for-highest-charting-new-artist-release-2009-09-01 Market Watch], Hollywood Music in Media Awards nominees retrieved, September 2, 2009 ''Music Connection'' magazine awarded Greg London a position on their Hot 100 Unsigned Artists List 2009 in the Adult Contemporary category as reported in the December 2009 issue. Hollywood Music in Media Awards HMMA - 2011 Nominee Best Adult Contemporary Song for "Don't Be So Hard On Yourself". ==Works== ===Singles discography=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! rowspan="2"|Year !! rowspan="2"|Single !! colspan="3"|US Charts |- !
